an5.66:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.
an5.66:4.3: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions posed when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
an5.66:4.4: They’re personally accomplished in samādhi, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in samādhi.
an5.66:4.5: They’re personally accomplished in wisdom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in wisdom.
an5.66:4.6: They’re personally accomplished in freedom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in freedom.
an5.66:4.7: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.66:4.8: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.”
